goal: Implement a block-tiled shared-memory GEMM kernel—load A and B sub-tiles into shared memory per block, synchronize threads, compute partial products in registers, and reduce global memory traffic via tiled accumulation.
details: Performance improved from 7.232 ms to 4.819 ms.

goal: Add shared-memory padding to eliminate bank conflicts (e.g., declare Asub[BLOCK_SIZE][BLOCK_SIZE+1] and Bsub[BLOCK_SIZE][BLOCK_SIZE+1] and adjust indexing), keeping the existing block-tiled algorithm.
details: New time 6.297 ms is not better than best time 4.819 ms.

goal: Implement per-thread register tiling (each thread computes a small sub-block of outputs, e.g., a 2x2 tile) combined with compile-time unrolling of the inner k-loop so each loaded shared-memory element is reused across multiple accumulators, increasing arithmetic intensity and reducing shared-memory/global-memory traffic.
details: New time 6.687 ms is not better than best time 4.819 ms.

goal: Increase the tile size (BLOCK_SIZE) to 32 (i.e., switch to 32x32 block-tiled shared-memory GEMM) to raise arithmetic intensity and data reuse per block (adjust shared-memory arrays and launch configuration accordingly) and evaluate performance/occupancy impacts.
details: Performance improved from 4.819 ms to 4.235 ms.

goal: Fully unroll the inner k-loop (the loop over k inside each shared-memory tile) via compile-time unrolling (e.g., #pragma unroll or template unroll for TILE=32) to increase instruction-level parallelism, enable load/store hoisting and register reuse, and reduce loop overhead for the current 32x32 block-tiled kernel.
details: New time 4.236 ms is not better than best time 4.235 ms.
